alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 2:18AM CDT until June 12 at 6:15AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From early this morning to Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 AM CDT Thursday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 21.4 feet by Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 1 AM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 19.7 Thu 1 AM 21.3 19.9 12.3 21.4 7 AM 6/10 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
